message: There are no hard numbers on how many human-trafficking victims passed through North Dakota, and until 2016, the state didn't track human trafficking. "What we want to do is treat victims like victims and not like perpetrators," Heitkamp said of anti-trafficking efforts, including the Abolish Human Trafficking Act.

data.description: Sept. 03–DICKINSON, N.D. — Darianne Johnson and her staff look back at the women who have come through the Domestic Violence and Rape Crisis Center in Dickinson and realize some of their clients were…
data.title: Hidden numbers: Accurate picture of human trafficking difficult, but agencies strive to recognize it
